Package asteroids.game

Class Participant

  • java.lang.Object
    • asteroids.game.Participant
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Asteroid, Bullet, Debris, Mine, Ship
    public abstract class Participant
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single moving element in an asteroids game. Each Participant object has an outline (used for drawing it), a position, a rotation, and a velocity. A Participant can be either "active" or "expired". An active Participant is displayed on the screen and can interact with other Participants. An expired Participant is not displayed on the screen, cannot interact with other Participants, and will be removed automatically from the game This is an abstract class, so it can be used only by creating a derived class that extends it and implements its abstract methods

    • Method Detail

      • expire

        public static void expire​(Participant p)
        Marks p as expired. If p is null, does nothing.

      • setInert

        public void setInert​(boolean b)
        Sets the inertness property. If a Participant is inert, its collisions with other Participants is ignored. Setting a participant inert when possible will improve the performance of the game.

      • isInert

        public boolean isInert()
        Reports whether this Participant is inert. If a Participant is inert, its collisions with other Participants is ignored. Setting a participant inert when possible will improve the performance of the game.

      • setExpired

        private void setExpired()
        Marks this participant as expired

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()
        Report whether this participant has expired.

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity​(double speed,
                        double direction)
        Sets the velocity of this participant. The speed is in pixels per frame refresh and the direction is in radians.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection​(double direction)
        Sets the direction, leaving the speed unchanged.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed​(double speed)
        Sets the speed, leaving the direction unchanged.

        public void rotate​(double delta)
        Rotates this Participant by delta radians.

        public double getRotation()
        Returns the rotation of this participant

      • normalize

        public static double normalize​(double angle)
        Adjusts the angle so it is between 0 and 2 Pi

      • accelerate

        public void accelerate​(double delta)
        Accelerates in the direction that the participant is rotated. Participants cannot accelerate beyond the speed limit.

      • applyFriction

        public void applyFriction​(double coefficientOfFriction)
        Simulates friction by accelerating the participant opposite to its direction of motion.

        public void setPosition​(double x,
                        double y)
        Sets the position of the center of the participant

        public double getX()
        Gets the x coordinate of the center of the participant

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Gets the y coordinate of the center of the participant

      • getOutline

        protected abstract java.awt.Shape getOutline()
        Returns a Shape object that describes the outline of this Participant. The center of the Shape should be at coordinate (0,0). The center is the reference used when the Shape is moved or rotated. This method is called frequently, so it should be efficient. The Shape that is returned will not be modified, so it can be cached. The Shape must have a non-zero area or no collisions will be detected. (E.g., a point or line has zero area.)

      • collidedWith

        public abstract void collidedWith​(Participant p)
        Takes the appropriate action for a collision of this Participant with p.

      • countdownComplete

        public void countdownComplete​(java.lang.Object payload)
        This method is called when a ParticipantCountdownTimer that was constructed for this Participant completes its countdown, so long as this Participant is not expired. The method should take appropriate action.

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves this participant to reflect one tick of the clock.

      • transformPoint

        public void transformPoint​(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double point)
        Transforms the point just like the participant is transformed before it is displayed. This can be used to figure out where some point of the participant is going to be located after it is transformed. (This can be useful for computing the tip of a ship, for example.)

      • overlaps

        public boolean overlaps​(Participant p)
        Reports whether this participant overlaps with p.

      • draw

        public void draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draws this participant
